thread.title: Moscow's Syria Campaign 'Breaks Chain of Color Revolutions' in Mid-East, Africa
thread.title_full: Moscow's Syria Campaign 'Breaks Chain of Color Revolutions' in Mid-East, Africa

title: Moscow's Syria Campaign 'Breaks Chain of Color Revolutions' in Mid-East, Africa
text:
Moscow's Syria Campaign 'Breaks Chain of Color Revolutions' in Mid-East, Africa © AFP 2016/ ANWAR AMRO Get short URL 0 50 0 0 Moscow has managed to break the chain of color revolutions in the Middle East, the Russian defense minister said. 
MOSCOW (Sputnik) — Russia's year-and-a-half counterterrorist campaign in Syria helped solve the geopolitical task of disrupting the chain of revolutions in the region, Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said Tuesday. "The deployment of our group in the Syrian Arab Republic helped solve the geopolitical task of breaking the chain of 'color revolutions' replicated in the Middle East and Africa," Shoigu said at a forum for young diplomats. © AFP 2016/ NIKOLAY DOYCHINOV Fearing New President's Approach to Russia, Foreign-Sponsored NGOs Plot Color Revolution Scenario for Bulgaria Since 2011, Syria has been engulfed in a civil war, with government forces fighting against numerous opposition and terrorist groups, including al-Nusra Front and Daesh , banned in a range of countries, including Russia. 
Moscow has been conducting a counter-terrorist campaign in Syria since September 30, 2015, at President Bashar Assad's request. 
Russian President Vladimir Putin announced in December that the Syrian government and armed opposition groups had reached an agreement on a nationwide ceasefire in Syria and on readiness to start peace talks. © Sputnik/
